raw_text:
Ferguson rues failure to cut gap
 
 Boss Sir Alex Ferguson was left ruing Manchester United's failure to close the gap on Chelsea, Everton and Arsenal after his side's 1-1 draw with Fulham.
 
 Premiership leaders Chelsea and the Gunners endured a 2-2 stalemate on Sunday, giving United the chance to make up some ground in the league. But Ferguson said: "I think what makes it so bad is that both our rivals dropped points at the weekend. "It was a great opportunity - and we haven't delivered." United went ahead through Alan Smith in the 33rd minute before Bouba Diop's superb 25-yard strike cancelled out the visitors' lead in the 87th minute. Ferguson described the result as an "absolute giveaway" after United had earlier missed a host of opportunities to finish off the encounter. He said: "It was a good performance - some of the football was fantastic - but we just didn't finish them off. "In fairness, it's a fantastic strike from the Fulham player." The result leaves Ferguson's side fourth in the league on 31 points - four points behind Arsenal and a further five back from Chelsea.
llama3.2:1b: Ferguson rues United's failure to cut gap after draw with Fulham, blaming rivals' dropped points for the loss.
llama3.2:3b: Manchester United failed to close the gap with Chelsea, Everton, and Arsenal after their 1-1 draw with Fulham, despite having a chance to make up ground following two draws by rivals Chelsea and Arsenal.
gemma2:2b: Sir Alex Ferguson expressed disappointment at Manchester United's draw with Fulham, as rivals Chelsea and Arsenal also drew, resulting in missed opportunities to narrow the gap in the Premier League standings. Despite a good performance, United failed to capitalize on their chances and ultimately fell behind before conceding an equalizer late in the game. The team remains fourth in the league with 31 points.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Ferguson criticized Manchester United's recent performances against Chelsea, Everton, and Arsenal, as they failed to close the gap with Fulham. Ferguson stated that while both teams dropped points at weekends, Manchester United managed to make up some ground in the league by defeating Fulham 1-0 on Sunday. Ferguson emphasized that it was a "great opportunity" for the team but conceded that their performance wasn't enough to end their match without finishing off. The team's goal came from Alan Smith, who scored in the 33rd minute, before Bouba Diop equalized in the 87th minute. Ferguson described this as an "absolute giveaway," and acknowledged that Manchester United didn't finish off the encounter well despite having missed opportunities earlier. The team finishes with a record of 31 points, 4 behind Arsenal and a further 5 back from Chelsea.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Manchester United failed to close gap with top teams after 1-1 draw against Fulham, leaving them fourth in the Premier League standings.
qwen2.5:3b: Ferguson regrets Manchester United's inability to narrow the gap with Chelsea, Everton, and Arsenal after their 1-1 draw against Fulham. Despite being ahead 1-0 through Alan Smith’s goal in the 33rd minute, United conceded a late equalizer by Bouba Diop. Ferguson criticized his team for missing multiple chances to secure the win, calling it an "absolute giveaway." Manchester United is now fourth in the league with 31 points, four behind Arsenal and five behind Chelsea.
opencoder:1.5b:
Ferguson rues failure to cut the gap between Manchester United and other teams like Chelsea, Everton and Arsenal.

In the absence of a proper penalty draw, Alex Ferguson lost a point to Man City in a 1-1 defeat with Fulham on Sunday. He then backed his side through Alan Smith in the 33rd minute before Bouba Diop's excellent 25-yard strike against the Gunners in the match. Despite this unexpected defeat, it was noteworthy that United had made up some ground to score more points. The result effectively leaves Ferguson's team fourth in the Premier League with 31 points.
smollm:1.7b: Ferguson rued failure to cut gap with Chelsea and Arsenal after Manchester United's 1-1 draw with Fulham.

<think>
Okay, so I need to summarize the provided text about Alex Ferguson's performance against Manchester United. Let me read through it carefully.

The first sentence mentions that Ferguson rues the failure to close the gap because his side lost to Fulham 1-1. That's an important detail—Ferguson is upset with how they didn't close the gap after losing two matches. 

Then, it says that Chelsea and United faced a 2-2 stalemate on Sunday, giving United more time to catch up. I should note the 2-2 outcome as well.

Ferguson mentions that both his rivals dropped points on the weekend, highlighting how tough the situation was. It's a bit of a downer because it shows their struggles.

United then scored an early goal through Alan Smith in the 33rd minute and Bouba Diop's superb strike in the 87th minute canceled out the visitors' lead. That's key—Diop's strike is crucial in a game where both teams have similar strengths.

Ferguson refers to this as an "absolute giveaway" after they missed several opportunities, but he also says it was a good performance because the players did well. The result leaves them fourth in the league with four points behind Arsenal and five ahead of Chelsea. That's the end of their current standings.

I need to make sure all these points are included concisely without adding any extra information. Focus on the main achievements and key moments like the scoreline, Diop's strike, and the final standings.
</think>

Ferguson rues Manchester United's failure to close the gap after losing 1-1 to Fulham, highlighting their struggles. Chelsea and United faced a 2-2 stalemate, giving United more time. United scored early through Alan Smith and Bouba Diop canceled visitors' lead. Ferguson called it an "absolute giveaway," praising his team for solid performance but noting missed opportunities. Final standings: fourth in the league with four points behind Arsenal and five ahead of Chelsea.

The Premier League leaders had an opportunity to make up some ground in the league, but their rivals both dropped points at the weekend. Ferguson criticized his team's performance for not finishing off opportunities and not taking advantage of the drop-off at Chelsea and Everton. United's result allowed Arsenal to move ahead of them, while Fulham is now just four points behind them.
